Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep body, a flat top and a long tapering nozzle. The wide filling-hole is in a plain area surrounded by a raised moulding terminating in a volute on each side of the nozzle-top. The nozzle has raised sides, and is decorated with a palmette in relief. On the left side is a lug, marked but not pierced, defined from the top by two grooves. The lamp stands on a double base-ring. Covered with a red slip, except under the base and the lower keel of the nozzle.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q549.bis)
